title: Rumour Mill: Messi approves Neymar replacement
text:
LIONEL Messi gives the green light to sign a player who could replace Neymar, the fee Leicester want for Riyad Mahrez, and Eden Hazard’s set for a new deal. 
Catch up on the latest transfer links in Rumour Mill! 
MESSI APPROVES DYBALA TRANSFER 
Lionel Messi has approved of Barcelona’s plan to sign Juventus’ Paulo Dybala , which would open the door for Neymar to move to PSG or the Premier League, according to Corriere dello Sport. 
After Barca’s last-gasp escape against PSG in the Champions League, and with Real Madrid leading the La Liga title battle, bosses of the Calatan giant reportedly want to shake-up the forward line. 
Juve striker Dybala is reportedly their top target, and the player reportedly wants a move to the Nou Camp after reportedly rejecting a move a year ago. 
Now there’s also a reported promise of a starting spot for the Argentine at the expense of Neymar, who was linked with a move to the French giant before signing a new five-year deal with Barca. Juventus' Argentinian forward Paulo Dybala (L). Source: AFP 
FEE FOR MAHREZ TO BARCA 
Leicester’s Riyad Mahrez is another target for Barca, but the Foxes will demand a fee in excess of £40m, according to The Telegraph. 
Sport reported Mahrez has held talks with the La LIga side and is keen to complete a move at the end of the season. 
The Algerian, who signed a new £100,000 a week contract in August, was reportedly approached by Chelsea and Arsenal last summer. Leicester City's Algerian midfielder Riyad Mahrez (C). Source: AFP 
POCH MEETS BARCA PRESIDENT 
Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino has fuelled more speculation he could become the new Barcelona coach after meeting with the club’s president Josep Maria Bartomeu this week, according to The Mirror. 
The Spanish champions are looking for a new manager with Luis Enrique set to depart in the summer. 
Pochettino and Bartomeu, who are friends, met at a restaurant in Barcelona, but Spurs were reportedly aware of the meeting and believe it’s nothing to worry over. It comes days after Pochettino signed a bumper new £5.5m-a-year Spurs deal that runs until 2021. 
Barcelona have also announced that they won’t chase Athletic Bilbao manager Ernesto Valverde to take over. Tottenham Hotspur's Argentinian head coach Mauricio Pochettino. Source: AFP 
CHELSEA TO HAND HAZARD NEW DEAL 
To fend off interest from Real Madrid, Chelsea are planning on offering a new deal to Eden Hazard , according to The Mirror. 
Hazard signed a new £200,000-a-week contract two years ago, but those terms could be improved on to keep him at Stamford Bridge. 
The Blues also reportedly plan to tie down goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois to a new deal worth £200,000-a-week, amid speculation he could leave. Eden Hazard. Source: Getty Images 
Chelsea have also reportedly been targeting Southampton defender Virgin van Dijk , who is rated at £50m, but will face a challenge from Liverpool, according to The Evening Standard. 
Instead the Blues may direct their attention to Napoli defender Kalidou Koulibaly , who said a move to England would make him happy. 
The Senegal defender has been linked with the Blues and Everton since last summer, and after his nation’s match in London, he hinted he’d enjoy playing in the English capital. 
Speaking to TalkSPORT, he explained: “It would make me happy to come and play here, but I now I have to go to Napoli.” 
“Now I concentrate on my club and we will see next season what I have to do.” Napoli's French defender Kalidou Koulibaly (top). Source: AFP 
But Chelsea will have to battle Manchester United to sign Claudio Marchisio , according to Football Italia. 
Both sides are reportedly keen on the 31-year-old Serie A midfielder. 
WENGER AND OZIL LATEST 
Arsene Wenger has held further talks over his future this week ahead of committing to a new two-year deal, according to The Mirror. 
But Mesut Ozil has downplayed rumours he could leave the club amid media and fan speculation. 
He said: “The fact is I’ve still got a contract in London. 
“To speculate now would be wrong. At the end of the season we will see, there will be talks. I’m very happy at Arsenal and in London.” 
Wenger said he will make his decision “very soon”, but Ozil and Alexis Sanchez’s future don’t seem any clearer. 
TOTTENHAM TO OFFLOAD JANSSEN 
Tottenham haven’t even finished paying off Vincent Janssen’s transfer fee to AZ Alkmaar after he joined the Spurs last summer, but they want to sell him, according to The Mirror. Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino, right, talk to Tottenham's Vincent Janssen. Source: AP 
The 22-year-old Netherlands striker has scored one goal from open play since his move, and now the club is reportedly ready to part with him. 
Erik Lamela’s future at Spurs is also in doubt after a row over the 25-year-old’s treatment for a hip injury, according to The Times. 
TRANSFER BITES 
- Middlesbrough’s England new boy Ben Gibson is poised to join one of the Premier League’s top six clubs this summer, according to The Mail.
